Abdera(Ancient Greek:langgrcἌβδηρα) was a majorancient GreeceGreekpolison the coast ofThrace. It lay 17 km east-northeast of the mouth of theNestos River, almost directly opposite the island ofThasos. The site now lies in theXanthi (regional unit)Xanthiregional unit ofwestern ThraceThrace,Greece. The municipality of Abdera (Modern Greek:langelΆβδηραIPA-elˈavðira) has 19,005 inhabitants (2011).
article.heading: History
article.paragraph: File:Abdera location.jpgthumb250pxleftLocation of Abdera and its two successivemetropolises,ClazomenaeandTeos.File:Abderacoin.pngthumb200pxrightThe chief coin type, with griffon.Its mythical foundation was attributed toHeracleswho founded the city on behalf of his fallen friendAbderus.Pseudo-Apollodorus,BibliothekeBibliotheca, ed. Wagner, R. Leipzig: Teubner, 1894;Mythographi Graeci1, Chapter 2, section 97, line 7ff.The historical founding is traced back to a colony fromKlazomenai. This historical founding was traditionally dated to 654 BC, which is unverified, although evidence in 7th century BCPottery of ancient GreeceGreek potterytends to support it.cite encyclopediaHornblowerSimonAbderaThe Oxford Classical Dictionary1Oxford University PressOxford1996But its prosperity dates from 544 BC, when the majority of the people ofTeos(including the poetAnacreon) migrated to Abdera to escape theIranPersianyoke (Herodotusi.168).cite encyclopediaEncyclopædia BritannicaAbdera15th2010Encyclopædia Britannica, Inc.I: A-Ak - BayesChicago, IL978-1-59339-837-819The chief coin type, agriffon, is identical with that of Teos; the rich silver coinage is noted for the beauty and variety of its reverse types.

In 513 BC and 512 BC, the Persians conquered Abdera. In 492 BC, the Persians again conquered Abdera, this time underDarius I. It later became part of theDelian Leagueand fought on the side of Athens in thePeloponnesian war.Diodorus Siculus,Bibliotheca historica, ed. Vogel, F., Fischer, K.T. (post I. Bekker & L. Dindorf), Leipzig: Teubner, 1:1888; 2:1890; 3:1893; 45:1906, Repr. 1964. Book 13, chapter 72, section 2, line 2.
Abdera was a wealthy city, the third richest in the League, due to its status as a prime port for trade with the interior of Thrace and theOdrysian kingdom.

A valuable prize, the city was repeatedly sacked: by theTriballiin 376 BC,Philip II of Macedonin 350 BC; later byLysimachusLysimachos of Thrace,theSeleucid EmpireSeleucids, thePtolemaic dynastyPtolemies, and again by the Macedonians. In 170 BC the Roman armies and those ofEumenes IIEumenes II of Pergamonbesieged and sacked it.

The town seems to have declined in importance after the middle of the 4th century BC. Cicero ridicules the city in his letters to Atticus, "Hic, Abdera non tacente me"Cicero.Epistulae ad Atticum, 4.17.3, 7.7.4.but the city counted among its citizens the philosophersDemocritus,ProtagorasandAnaxarchus, historian and philosopherHecataeus of Abdera, and the lyric poetAnacreon.

link.part: The west gate of classical Abdera

article.paragraph: Abdera had flourished especially in ancient times mainly for two reasons : because of the large area of their territory and their highly strategic position. The city controlled two great road passages (one of Nestos river and other through the mountains north of Xanthi). Furthermore, from their ports passed the sea road, which from Troas led to the Thracian and then the Macedonian coast.D. C. Samsaris, Historical Geography of Western Thrace during the Roman Antiquity (in Greek), Thessaloniki 2005, p. 91-96

The ruins of the town may still be seen on Cape Balastra (4056'1.02"N 2458'21.81"E); they cover seven small hills, and extend from an eastern to a western harbor; on the southwestern hills are the remains of the medieval settlement of Polystylon.
article.heading: Municipality
article.paragraph: The municipality Abdera was formed at the 2011 local government reform by the merger of the following 3 former municipalities, that became municipal units:Kallikratis lawGreece Ministry of Interiorel icon

The municipal unit Abdera is subdivided into the communities Abdera,Mandra, XanthiMandra,MyrodatoandNea Kessani. The community Abdera consists of the settlements Abdera,Giona, XanthiGiona, Lefkippos,Pezoulaand Skala.
